verses.roman:
ei cāri haite cabbiśa mūrti parakāśa
astra-bhede nāma-bheda--vaibhava-vilāsa

synonyms: ei cāri haite—from these four; cabbiśa—twenty-four; mūrti—forms; parakāśa—manifestation; astra-bhede—according to the different weapons; nāma-bheda—the difference of names; vaibhava-vilāsa—the vaibhava pastime expansions.
translation: "From the original quadruple expansion, twenty-four forms are manifest. They differ according to the placement of weapons in Their four hands. They are called vaibhava-vilāsa.
